image.altText: composite of banks,, a wanted poster and Kym Parsons over a map of the locations hit

props.synopsis: Over 10 years, the notorious "bicycle bandit" terrorised innocent bank tellers at gunpoint. His identity remained a mystery for almost two decades until police used a game changing forensic technique to unmask the culprit.

title.children: Unmasking the bicycle bandit: How cops caught the notorious armed robber

image.altText: southern right whales mating in clear, turquoise sea water.

props.synopsis: At opposite ends of the planet, a tale of two whale species has emerged — giving researchers hope and concern in equal measure.

title.children: Southern right whales can live up to 150 years, but others aren't so lucky

image.altText: A blurred photo of a man outside court after his brother was charged with criminal neglect

props.synopsis: A South Australian father has been denied bail after he allegedly inflicted injuries to his daughter consistent with her being "thrown into a wall".

title.children: Court told three-month-old sustained brain injury as father is denied bail

image.altText: Two men smile in a workshop-style building.

props.synopsis: It started as a quick job to replace a rotting model boat at the entrance to the town of American River on Kangaroo Island, but it grew into a much bigger project: to build a full-size, operational replica of the sailing ship.

title.children: 'Mad dream' to rebuild 1800s sailing ship

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: An investigation has found 18 staff either engaged in misconduct or inappropriately accessed the records of a patient who died after a hit and run crash last year, understood to be the son of the state's police commissioner.

title.children: 18 SA Health staff resigned or sanctioned for accessing Charlie Stevens's medical record

image.altText: A blurred black-and-white photo of a small boy apparently with a bandaged head.

props.synopsis: The man and the child's mother are alleged to have raised $60,000 in donations over two weeks.

title.children: Adelaide father who allegedly faked son's cancer diagnosis granted bail

image.altText: A close-up photo of a young man wearing a collared shirt and tie.

props.synopsis: The deputy state coroner has found the advice given by a social worker at a mental health triage centre to 20-year-old Kobee Huddy before his death was "not satisfactory".

title.children: Coronial inquest finds mental health triage service was not satisfactory before shooting death

image.altText: Kay Lawrence smiles, she has grey hair. Wears dark rimmed glasses and weaves threads together with her hands

props.synopsis: Women's suffrage was the work of many hands, and two tapestries that celebrate Australia's part in that story, and that were woven by more than 1,000 members of the public, are in pride of place at a new exhibition.

title.children: The story of women's suffrage was partly woven in SA, and is told in two tapestries

image.altText: South Australia's Treasurer Stephen Mullighan.

props.synopsis: South Australia's government has reported a mid-year surplus, but the state's Treasurer says there won't be more big spends like the Torrens to Darlington and Women's and Children's Hospital projects until they are completed.

title.children: SA debt grows due to infrastructure and health, despite mid-year surplus

image.altText: Three women ride a motorbike under an archway with blue columns. A man drives a cart nearby.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's new President Prabowo Subianto wants to make the country one of the fastest-growing economies in the world. But data shows the country's middle class is shrinking.

title.children: Indonesia's middle class is shrinking – and that's bad news for Australia

image.altText: fire truck drives in front of a wall of flame and smoke in western Victoria

props.synopsis: Victorian emergency services have warned Halls Gap residents to leave immediately and holiday-makers to stay away, with a fire in the Grampians almost tripling in size in the past 24 hours.

title.children: Halls Gap residents told to evacuate as Grampians fire triples in size

image.altText: A person wearing a black cloak and hood with a beak sits on a hill, in front of a blue sky and desert outlook

props.synopsis: While many Australians await the arrival of Santa Claus, kids in outback Australia are celebrating with their own unique Christmas icon.

title.children: He's mysterious, scary and feathered — and he brings presents to outback kids

image.altText: black and white image of samuel paty with lady leaning to place flower by it

props.synopsis: France’s anti-terrorism court on Friday convicted eight people of involvement in the beheading of teacher Samuel Paty four years ago.

title.children: French court convicts eight people over beheading of teacher

image.altText: A close-up of Fauziah Basyriah in a florally patterned Hijab, looking sorrowfully at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Boxing Day tsunami interrupted a civil war, triggered the worst rail accident in history and shattered the lives of millions. Twenty years on, those who escaped certain death share their stories.

title.children: A disaster so big it sped up our planet's rotation. Its impacts are still felt today

image.altText: Annabel Sutherland on one knee plays a sweep shot in a white ball cricket match

props.synopsis: Annabel Sutherland has become the first woman in ODI cricket to hit consecutive centuries batting fifth or lower. Follow live.

title.children: Sutherland hits historic century as Australia set NZ 292 for victory

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: New Zealand need a record run chase to win

image.altText: Michae Mosley sits on the steps and poses for a photo with the Sydney Harbour Bridge behind him

props.synopsis: Crispin Butler, the senior coroner for Buckinghamshire, said Mosley's death "was most likely attributable either to heat stroke (accidental) or non-identified pathological cause".

title.children: Michael Mosley's cause of death unable to be determined by coroner

image.altText: An ASX share market digital board listing stocks in green and red lighting alongside the ASX logo

props.synopsis: Shares have suffered heavy falls to end the trading week, and some economists say a trending change in markets could mean the rout is not over yet.

title.children: Donald Trump's tariffs and inflation threaten record run-up in shares

image.altText: A close up of a Christmas tree with people seen socialising in the background

props.synopsis: So much of what we hope and expect from Christmas is performative, and springs from the presentation of a perfect family holiday that inevitably is unattainable. It's hard to pick the fake when everyone is so desperately in search of the real.

title.children: This year I'm freed from a family legacy of complicated Christmases

image.altText: A composite image of three logos consisting of coles, woolworths and aldi

props.synopsis: The ACCC's supermarket inquiry has shone a spotlight on Coles and Woolworths' high prices. But 76 per cent of shoppers still head to either store for their primary grocery shop.

title.children: Habit driving consumers to Coles and Woolies despite cheaper alternatives

image.altText: Aerial view of brown river and spillway

props.synopsis: Two people have been rescued after their car became trapped in floodwaters in the Whitsundays as flooding rains shift out to sea.

title.children: Two rescued as Townsville's wild weather heads to sea, to relief of Mackay and Whitsundays

image.altText: Spain celebrates with the Women's World Cup following their win in the 2023 final.

props.synopsis: In a move illustrating the changing face of live sport programming, Netflix secures the US rights to the Women's World Cup in 2027 and 2031.

title.children: Netflix signs US broadcast deal with FIFA for next two Women's World Cups

image.altText: A close-up of a woman's face with blood coming out of her eyes and mouth.

props.synopsis: F. W. Murnau’s vampire classic has cast a long shadow over horror for the past 100 years. Now, The Lighthouse director Rober Eggers has put his own dark spin on the terrifying tale.

title.children: 100 years on from the original, the new Nosferatu makes vampires scary again

image.altText: Packets of Codral and Sudafed opened

props.synopsis: A Brisbane law firm has filed a class action against Johnson & Johnson alleging the pharmaceutical giant made false claims about the effectiveness of popular brands of cold and flu medication.

title.children: Class action filed against Johnson & Johnson over 'ineffective' flu medication

image.altText: Two medication boxes, one resting on top of the other.

props.synopsis: There's growing concern about how people stop taking antidepressant medication, particularly if they have been on it for a long time. Researchers say the process needs to be slowed down.

title.children: Growing alarm about how people come off antidepressants 'too quickly'

image.altText: A dump truck emptying a pile of red dirt into a very large mine - there are hills in the background.

props.synopsis: Most of WA's iron ore is processed overseas, producing huge amounts of carbon emissions, but a new project aims to turn it into "green steel" in Perth. Here's what experts say about its feasibility.

title.children: WA is flush with iron ore, and now there's a chance steel could be made there too

image.altText: a graphic of black and white photos including a newspaper clipping and photo of Phillip Lamont

props.synopsis: Although police were confident they had caught the Ether Man, no charges were ever laid.

title.children: 'You've got me, charge me': The lucky break that helped police catch a serial Brisbane rapist

image.altText: Protesters set off fireworks in Tbilisis

props.synopsis: The people of Georgia are in the streets of Tbilisi, protesting the ruling party’s recent election win. At the heart of the fight is whether the country should appease Vladimir Putin, or oppose him. For years Georgia was moving closer to the European Union, but the war in Ukraine changed everything.

title.children: Putin or the EU? Georgia's big fight | If You’re Listening

image.altText: close up image of man in a navy suit leaving the italian senate, he has a face mask around his neck

props.synopsis: An Italian court on Friday acquitted Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini of illegally blocking migrants on a rescue ship in 2019, after a lengthy and high-profile trial.

title.children: Italy's Deputy PM Matteo Salvini cleared of illegally detaining migrants

image.altText: Australia celebrates the final wicket, the umpire standing with his finger in the air

props.synopsis: Dehydration, a double century, and disputed decisions. The 1986 Tied Test between India and Australia was one of the most dramatic cricket matches in the sport's history.

title.children: Dehydration, a double century, and disputed decisions of the 1986 Tied Test

image.altText: LeBron James dribbles the ball against Sacremento Kings.

props.synopsis: In the midst of his 22nd season, LeBron James claims another NBA milestone as he helps Los Angeles Lakers defeat Sacramento Kings 113-100.

title.children: LeBron James breaks Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's 35-year-old NBA record

image.altText: A man with beard speaks calmly at a mosque.

props.synopsis: Ahmed al-Sharaa, also known as Abu Mohammed al-Golani, is the leader of the Islamist group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham that led a push to oust Bashar al-Assad from power.

title.children: US drops $16m reward for arrest of Syria's new leader amid 'positive messages'

image.altText: A woman is on a jet ski in flood waters and a truck that's covered in water is next to her.

props.synopsis: All of the nine people who have caused a fatality after driving into southern Queensland floodwater since 2021 have been men.

title.children: Statistics show experienced male drivers most likely to die on flooded roads

image.altText: An antechinus nibbles at a human finger

props.synopsis: Scientists are fortifying a national park at the southern tip of Australia's mainland to keep invasive predators away from endangered native plants and animals.

title.children: Countless animals could be saved from extinction thanks to this national park
